text.section: If, after a hearing on petition of an adoptee or former parent, a court is satisfied that the adoptee or blood relative of the adoptee or former parent urgently needs medical information not in court records, the court may appoint an intermediary to try to contact the adoptee or a former parent of the adoptee for the information.

An intermediary appointed under this section:
only may advise an adoptee or former parent of the need for medical information; and
may not:
reveal any identifying information about an adoptee or former parent; or
try, in any manner, to encourage or discourage contact between an adoptee and former parent.
An intermediary appointed under this section shall file with the appointing court a confidential written report on the intermediary's efforts to contact an adoptee or former parent.

When a court receives a report from an intermediary, the court may disclose to the adoptee or former parent, without revealing identifying information about the adoptee or any former parent:
whether the intermediary advised the adoptee or a former parent about the need for medical information; and
medical information that the adoptee or a former parent provided.
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a court may order an adoptee or former parent to pay a reasonable fee for the services of an intermediary under this section.
